reviews.review: avengers infinity war is a superhero movie that doesn't look like a superhero movie at all. Its more like a novel  adaptation dress up as a superhero movie with convoluted plot, overused of cgi, too much destruction,weak villains and that includes thanos. And speaking of thanos, hes really out of character. Hes like hes trying to be noble but hes not and he doesn't have a clear motive. Hes just a big cgi generic villain just like most of marvels previous villains. Some of the characters are really out of character too. The relationship between Wanda and Vision, Gamora and Peter are bland.The movie is also too long.Overall, the movie is big pile of mess.
Pretty good interpretation of classic comic story.
Great movie! Is true Thanos demand your silence at the end.

great movie, probably the only one I have ever seen with a long run time that I didn't think should either have been shorter or lost interest at certain points. you feel the stakes are high throughout the whole movie, they manage to tie all the characters together, finally have a compelling villain, and good story line.
Dissapointing. Perhaps there was too much hype and it failed to live up to expectations. The most memorable Marvels movie of recent vintage has to be Thor Ragnorak.

An entertaining movie, but has the plot is unoriginal and doesn't work with what was established from the first Avengers movie. The CGI/Special Effects could've been better and the power levels of the characters are all over the place. This movie needed more time before it's April release.

I honestly can't properly talk about this movie without SPOILERS soooo...stop reading if you haven't seen it yet.

Damn. Seeing this on opening night with a theater packed full of fans was definitely the way to see it but it also highlighted the very bold (some might say questionable) way that it plays out. For 90% of the film it had us all smiling, cheering, and griping our seats with tension. It was both playful and thrilling which is typically a winning formula for a summer blockbuster if you nail the mix of those perfect - and they did - until that ending came along.

That ending.

With the snap of his finger Thanos destroys half of all life in the universe and we tragically watch as heroes we know and love turn to dust one by one. And then it ends.

Sure, we get a post credits scene that delivers more of this followed by a tiny glimmer of hope, but overall the vibe in the theater was still really weird. I fully expected the movie to end with our theater bursting into rapturous applause but instead there was nothing but shocked murmurs and the memory of people screaming, "FUCK!" when their favorite heroes turned to dust.

As an episode of TV this might have been a brilliant way to end things but for a 2.5 hour film that already took us through a roller coaster of emotions it can't help but feel a little incomplete. I was especially troubled by this after so many comments from Joe and Anthony Russo claiming that this will be a complete, satisfying movie than can stand alone from next year's untitled sequel. Sorry boys, but I'm going to have to call bullshit on that.

It was also tough to be fully affected by the ending when in just the past week reps from Marvel/Disney and Sony have talked about planning sequels for both Spider-Man and Black Panther. I know we would have found it hard to believe those characters are gone for good no matter what but a little more discretion on future plans could have gone a long way to adding gravitas to this film.

Gripes about the ending (and the odd choice of stripping Bruce's ability to Hulk out) aside, the film is an otherwise remarkable achievement. The sheer balancing act of managing every single one of these characters and their motivations is a mind-boggling screenwriting feat and should not be understated. The performances are sterling across the board and the visuals pop in all of their comic book glory.

It may not be Marvel Studio's greatest work but they've now set the table for Avengers 4 to be the most glorious piece of geek wonderment ever made. Here's hoping they don't let us down!
After seeing the Black Panther I was very disappointed. should've waited for DVD.
An absolute mess of a film. From awful CGI to corporate greed, this movie embodies everything wrong with hollywood in one painfully long 2 and a half hour session.
